intro: Anthoshorea resinosa, commonly known as the resinous anthoshorea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and striking yellow-orange flowers. The plant produces a sticky, aromatic resin that has been used traditionally in local medicine and as a natural adhesive. Its growth habit is typically shrub-like, with multiple stems and dense foliage. Anthoshorea resinosa thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland rainforests.
